Horizon Honors Alumnus Nikhil Dave was appointed to the Arizona Board of Regents by Gov. Doug Ducey on July 17. Regent Dave is currently an undergraduate student at Arizona State University who is earning a double major in neuroscience and innovation in society.

During summer break, Horizon Honors Schools continue to solidify a plan for the 2020-2021 school year. Our planning includes a comprehensive review of federal and local health and safety research, guidelines from the Arizona Department of Education, and state and community survey data.

As a result, we are pleased to announce that Horizon Honors is committed to providing both an on-campus learning option, as well as a distance-learning option, for all 2020-2021 students in Grades K-12. However, we believe further, more specific community input from our families is required in order to make final decisions for the start of the school year.

Please check your email for an important survey. Your input in this process is vital. Please complete the survey for each student you have enrolled in Grades K-12 at Horizon Honors Schools by Wednesday, June 17.

Final decisions for the 2020-2021 learning plans will be shared with our community no later than July 1.

Earlier this week, the Horizon Honors High School Law students had a virtual visit from Maricopa County Superior Court Judge Korbin-Steiner. After being both a criminal attorney and a family law practitioner, Judge Korbin-Steiner was appointed to the Superior Court in 2015. She is currently serving an assignment hearing criminal cases.

Korbin-Steiner talked about her decisions to become both lawyer and judge. She fielded questions about her daily routine on the bench as well as some of the biggest challenges in hearing criminal matters. She also talked about what was most rewarding about her role. She then shared a recent story of a criminal defendant finishing his sentencing statement by breaking into an acapella version of "Amazing Grace" (all four verses)!

The students who participated were so fortunate to have a few minutes with one of those who serve our community in this unique way and to hear first-hand about many of the things the class has discussed throughout the year.

Horizon Honors flags are at half-staff from sunrise to sunset today, February 18, in honor of White Mountain Apache Police Officer David Kellywood.

Officer Kellywood was killed in the line of duty while responding to a report of gunshots fired south of Pinetop-Lakeside, Arizona. Officer Kellywood joined the department nine months ago after graduating from the police academy. Born in McNary, Arizona, Officer Kellywood was a member of the White Mountain Apache Tribe.

Turn your Coca-Cola product purchases into donations to Horizon Honors Schools!

We’re excited to share that our school is part of the Coca-Cola Give program. This opens up Horizon Honors Schools to new funding opportunities to help improve learning environments for students. The best part- Donations don’t come out of your own pocket.

When you make a Coca-Cola product purchases ( Dasani water, FUZE teas, Minute-Maid lemonade, Powerade, regular and diet sodas)

You simply scan or enter the product codes here: https://us.coca-cola.com/give/schools/ choose Horizon Honors.

You will need to make an account with a current email and password and then we receive a donation or we have designated spots in each office to collect clean caps and/or cut-out labels with codes on them that can get entered for you.

Find Codes:
-under all product caps of individual sized plastic bottles
-2-liter bottle caps
-plastic covering for canned cases
-cardboard boxes of 6 thru 35 canned packs

Codes are worth between $0.05- $0.38 each. Every code counts, so spread the word to friends and family.
